subtitleNullable: Social Media data on addiction and dependency in South East Asia
descriptionNullable:
This dataset provides an extensive overview of social media addiction and its impact on daily functioning and mental well-being across five Southeast Asian countries: Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, the Philippines, and Vietnam. It includes 184,591 rows of data, capturing various demographic, behavioral, and mental health aspects related to social media usage.
Fields Included:

    Country: The country of the respondent (Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, Vietnam).
    Age Group: The age group of the respondent (18-25, 26-35, 36-45, 46-55).
    Gender: The gender of the respondent (Male, Female).
    Urban/Rural: Indicates whether the respondent lives in an urban or rural area.
    Daily SM Usage (hrs): The average number of hours per day the respondent spends on social media.
    Most Used SM Platform: The most frequently used social media platform (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok).
    Frequency of SM Use: How often the respondent uses social media (Daily, Week
